medical_history.history_of_present_illness: One year before admission, the patient developed dyspnea, leg edema, and abdominal distention, becoming progressively incapacitated and bedridden with dyspnea on exertion and paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea. Two days before admission, he experienced fever, myalgia, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea leading up to a cardiac arrest.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), hyperlipidemia, hypertension, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, gastroesophageal reflux disease, history of right nephrectomy due to myxoid liposarcoma, lupus nephritis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died with dementia; father had positive ANA test; two sisters died in their 40s, one from ovarian cancer and another from pancreatitis related to severe juvenile-onset SLE-myositis overlap syndrome; brother has coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked cigarettes (22 pack-years), previously abused alcohol but abstinent for the last 5 years; receives disability payments.
